ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Central auditory dysfunction secondary to Alzheimer's disease
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Severe left-ear deficits on dichotic tests and bilateral deficits on temporal processing tasks are consistent with cortical/interhemispheric involvement often seen in dementia.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Peripheral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Mild high-frequency loss is present but does not fully explain the patient's significant difficulty in noise.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess speech recognition abilities in quiet.
To evaluate central auditory function given complaints of hearing in noise and stuttering.
To assess integrity of central auditory pathways.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates a mild peripheral high-frequency hearing loss that is insufficient to explain his difficulties. Central testing reveals significant deficits, particularly a severe left-ear deficit on dichotic tasks and bilateral deficits on temporal processing tests, consistent with central auditory involvement secondary to Alzheimer's disease.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild, bilateral high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss. RE thresholds: 10-25 dB HL; LE thresholds: 15-50 dB HL (250-8000 Hz).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Speech recognition in quiet was essentially normal bilaterally (RE 96%, LE 88%).

tests.name: Central Auditory Processing Tests
tests.result_summary: Major deficits noted. Severe left ear deficits on dichotic tests (Competing Sentences ~0%, Dichotic Digits ~50%, SSW ~28%). Bilateral deficits on compressed speech and frequency patterns.

tests.name: Electrophysiology (MLR)
tests.result_summary: Test completed but fraught with artifact; difficult to interpret.

proposed_items: Trial of Assistive Listening Devices (ALDs) (preferred over hearing aids due to dementia considerations)
Consider hearing aids if appropriate support is available
counseling_actions: Discuss central auditory involvement as the primary contributor to difficulties in noise
Explain that 'left ear deficit' relates to brain processing rather than the ear itself
Counsel on communication strategies with patient and wife
Discuss pros and cons of ALDs versus traditional hearing aids regarding manipulation and maintenance

escalation.destination: local audiologist or hearing healthcare provider
escalation.rationale_short: Patient lives a long distance from the center; referral to a local provider is necessary for amplification/ALD trial and management.

follow_up_plan.objective: Patient returned home; recommended local follow-up for amplification options.
